solution_line_template: Tina buys {num_packs} {sodas_in_a_pack}-packs of soda, for {num_packs}*{sodas_in_a_pack}= <<{num_packs}*{sodas_in_a_pack}={initial_sodas}>>{initial_sodas} sodas
{total_people} people attend the party, so half of them is {total_people}/{half_divisor}= <<{total_people}/{half_divisor}={people_in_half_group}>>{people_in_half_group} people

Each of those people drinks {sodas_per_person_half_group} sodas, so they drink {people_in_half_group}*{sodas_per_person_half_group}=<<{people_in_half_group}*{sodas_per_person_half_group}={sodas_drank_by_half_group}>>{sodas_drank_by_half_group} sodas

Two people drink {sodas_per_person_group2} sodas, which means they drink {num_people_group2}*{sodas_per_person_group2}=<<{num_people_group2}*{sodas_per_person_group2}={sodas_drank_by_group2}>>{sodas_drank_by_group2} sodas

With one person drinking {sodas_drank_by_group3}, that brings the total drank to {sodas_drank_by_group3}+{sodas_drank_by_half_group}+{sodas_drank_by_group2}=<<{sodas_drank_by_group3}+{sodas_drank_by_half_group}+{sodas_drank_by_group2}={total_sodas_drank}>>{total_sodas_drank} sodas
As Tina started off with {initial_sodas} sodas, that means there are {initial_sodas}-{total_sodas_drank}=<<{initial_sodas}-{total_sodas_drank}={sodas_left}>>{sodas_left} sodas left
